meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for some groovy gaming goodness as I dish out my thoughts on Braid: Anniversary Edition. You know what's even more fun than playing the game? Reading about it from self-proclaimed experts like God is a Geek, Push Square, PlayStation Universe, Video Chums, PlayStation LifeStyle, and Hobby Consolas (I'm looking at you, Noisy Pixel - nice try, but I got this)! Okay, let me get my serious face on for a sec...

In all seriousness, Braid: Anniversary Edition is the definitive edition of a timeless classic that still holds up today. The visuals are stunning, with crisp graphics and vibrant colors that make the game almost too pretty to play (almost). The puzzles? Yeah, they're still tough yet rewarding - like trying to figure out my Netflix login password after a few too many groggy mornings.

What's new in this anniversary edition? Well, aside from the fancy visual makeover, there are extra levels, enhanced developer commentary, and... that's about it, folks! But honestly, who needs more when you have the perfect blend of art and design? The game still retains its linear progression, uncompromising puzzles, and timeless charm.

So, is Braid: Anniversary Edition worth your time? Well, if you're a newcomer or an old fan looking to relive the magic, this edition is definitely the way to go. If you've already experienced the original, it's up to you whether the extra features are enough to justify double-dipping (myself included - I mean, who doesn't love a good re-visit every now and then?).

All in all, Braid: Anniversary Edition is an excellent way to experience this gaming masterpiece. So, grab your controller, put on your thinking cap, and get ready for some groovy gaming fun!
